intro: Ageratina haageana, commonly known as the velvetleaf ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in dense clusters, giving it a fluffy appearance. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its common name. Ageratina haageana is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
